ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: What you have been promised is sheer nonsense!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: How far-fetched what you are promised;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Far-fetched, utterly far-fetched is what you are being promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Such a promise will never come true.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “How remote, (really) how remote is the promise you are given!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Far, very far is that which you are promised!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Far, far is that which you are threatened with.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Away, away with that you are promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Begone, begone, with that which ye are promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: What you are promised is indeed far-fetched.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Away! away with that wherewith ye are promised;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Far-fetched, far-fetched is what you are promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Far, very far is that which ye are promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Far, very far is that which you are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: After, after with that which you are promised!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Farfetched, farfetched is what you are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:36] Far-fetched, far-fetched (hayhāt is a noun of action in the past tense, functioning as a verbal noun, meaning ba‘uda ba‘uda, ‘far from it, far from it!’) is what you are promised!, in the way of being brought forth from the graves (li-mā: the lām is extra, for explication).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Be gone, be gone, with that which ye are promised!) how farfetched, how farfetched! This will never be.
